page_index.composition: This program is structured in 2 parts :
page_index.univers: Friedmann-Lemaître universes models and annex calculations
page_index.trajectoire: Trajectory of a free particule in the Schwarzschild & Kerr space-time

page_apropos.encadrants: The supervisory staff : Jean-Pierre Cordoni & Henri Reboul (LUPM), Isabelle Mougenot (LIRMM)
page_apropos.remerciements: Thanks to Éric Gourgoulhon (LUTH) and Jean-Philippe Uzan (IAP) for their advice.
page_apropos.version: Beta Version 1.1 (2021/02/01) revised by Jean Pierre Cordoni
page_apropos.descriptif: Application created in the framework of tutored projects of the Master 1 of Digital Physics of the University of Montpellier.

page_univers_general.avertissement: The Universe simulation with it's annex calculations allows 10 or so parameters to be chosen(counting the fundamental constants). The current code is obviously not robust on all the accessible domain of this 10 dimensional space. We hope the results are exact in a 'prudent' neighborhood of the standard model, of the usual observable values (z, thêta) and of the fundamental constants. We think that they are still exact for universes very different from our own but it's obvious that the simulation's chances to fail(too long of a calculation time on the user's processor) or, worse, of erroneous results increase the further away we go from the standard model. The 'mono-fluids' option, with it's analytical formalism, allows us to explore more accurately those extremes. Near the 'seperators(?)' between different types of universes(with or without a Big Bang, with or without a Big Crunch), an automatic warning is normally displayed.

pages_trajectoire.rayonPhyInfHorz: Physical radius biggest than horizon radius !
pages_trajectoire.rayonHorzInfRayonSchw: Please, input a value of r0 higher than Schwarschild's radius !

pages_trajectoire.lancerInterdit: Throw in physical radius is forbidden !
pages_trajectoire.avertissement:
The simulations of the trajectories respect the velocity dynamics. When the initial conditions are chosen to make this dynamic too big, the calculation step becomes too big(the trajectory appears in dots) near the periaster and this creates mistakes in the rest of the trajectory. The plus and minus buttons are there to interactively adapt the calculation step for those excentric orbitals.
A too big of a modification on this 'speed' will alter the precision of the trajectory.
The initial values of Ur and Uφ are always functions
from τ (space walker own time) or from λ (photon parameter).
pages_trajectoire.commandes_horsSchwarMassif:
Keyboard : 

- Complete trajectory : key a 
- Simple trajectory : key z
- Stop the calculate : key q 
- Reset : key s 
- Save : key d 
- Last values : key f 
- Slow down : key w 
- Pause / Read : key x 
- Speed up : key c

page_trajectoire_massive.titre: Trajectory of a massive projectile with Schwarzschild metric
page_trajectoire_massive.particule_arretee: The projectile landed on the celestial body's surface.
page_trajectoire_massive.particule_ecrasee: The projectile crashed on the celestial body's surface.
page_trajectoire_massive.particule_atteint_rh: The projectile has gotten to Rh+.
